mikejmc5580 said:

Steve said:

. However, if she is mad and determined, that can only make her more interesting - the one thing Rihanna lacks is a discernible personality.

You mean if we take vocal prowess, songwriting talent and the ability to dance without appearing operated by a remote control in a separate building out of the equation?

I think Rihanna is a solid popstar in terms of distinctive vocal (if not technically amazing) and stage presence (I saw a recent MTV airing of one of her Canadian concerts, and whilst not a show of epic pop proportions, as you'd expect from the likes of Madonna or Britney, it was fairly solid show). Isnt her style of choreography meant to be a bit robotic? I agree on the songwriting front, although I'm sure she does have one or two credits in her catalogue.

Ciara going to Johnny Wright is an amazing step for her; he is often not credited, but he was a key player in steering Britney to worldwide success, with the contacts and history that Larry Rudolph just wasn't able to provide at the time. I'm excited for her new album, I think "The Evolution" is one of the best R&B records of the past 5 years; something Janet would have killed to get hold of.
